Definition: mesh_base.h:1170
void libMesh::MeshBase::prepare_for_use ( )
inherited

在文件 mesh_base.C 第 740 行定义.

参考 libMesh::MeshBase::_allow_remote_element_removal, libMesh::MeshBase::_is_prepared, libMesh::MeshBase::_skip_find_neighbors, libMesh::MeshBase::_skip_renumber_nodes_and_elements, libMesh::MeshBase::cache_elem_data(), libMesh::MeshBase::clear_point_locator(), libMesh::ParallelObject::comm(), libMesh::MeshBase::delete_remote_elements(), libMesh::MeshBase::detect_interior_parents(), libMesh::MeshBase::find_neighbors(), libMesh::MeshBase::get_boundary_info(), libMesh::MeshBase::is_serial(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::MeshTools::libmesh_assert_valid_boundary_ids(), libMesh::MeshTools::libmesh_assert_valid_unique_ids(), libMesh::MeshBase::partition(), libMesh::BoundaryInfo::regenerate_id_sets(), libMesh::MeshBase::reinit_ghosting_functors(), libMesh::MeshBase::remove_orphaned_nodes(), libMesh::MeshBase::renumber_nodes_and_elements(), libMesh::MeshBase::skip_partitioning() , 以及 libMesh::MeshBase::update_parallel_id_counts().

参考自 libMesh::UnstructuredMesh::all_complete_order(), libMesh::UnstructuredMesh::all_first_order(), libMesh::UnstructuredMesh::all_second_order_range(), libMesh::UnstructuredMesh::copy_nodes_and_elements(), libMesh::MeshBase::prepare_for_use(), libMesh::UnstructuredMesh::read() , 以及 libMesh::UnstructuredMesh::stitching_helper().

741 {
742  LOG_SCOPE("prepare_for_use()", "MeshBase");
743 
744  parallel_object_only();
745 
746  libmesh_assert(this->comm().verify(this->is_serial()));
747 
748  // A distributed mesh may have processors with no elements (or
749  // processors with no elements of higher dimension, if we ever
750  // support mixed-dimension meshes), but we want consistent
751  // mesh_dimension anyways.
752  //
753  // cache_elem_data() should get the elem_dimensions() and
754  // mesh_dimension() correct later, and we don't need it earlier.
755 
756 
757  // Renumber the nodes and elements so that they in contiguous
758  // blocks. By default, _skip_renumber_nodes_and_elements is false.
759  //
760  // Instances where you if prepare_for_use() should not renumber the nodes
761  // and elements include reading in e.g. an xda/r or gmv file. In
762  // this case, the ordering of the nodes may depend on an accompanying
763  // solution, and the node ordering cannot be changed.
764 
765 
766  // Mesh modification operations might not leave us with consistent
767  // id counts, or might leave us with orphaned nodes we're no longer
768  // using, but our partitioner might need that consistency and/or
769  // might be confused by orphaned nodes.
770  if (!_skip_renumber_nodes_and_elements)
771  this->renumber_nodes_and_elements();
772  else
773  {
774  this->remove_orphaned_nodes();
775  this->update_parallel_id_counts();
776  }
777 
778  // Let all the elements find their neighbors
779  if (!_skip_find_neighbors)
780  this->find_neighbors();
781 
782  // The user may have set boundary conditions. We require that the
783  // boundary conditions were set consistently. Because we examine
784  // neighbors when evaluating non-raw boundary condition IDs, this
785  // assert is only valid when our neighbor links are in place.
786 #ifdef DEBUG
787  MeshTools::libmesh_assert_valid_boundary_ids(*this);
788 #endif
789 
790  // Search the mesh for all the dimensions of the elements
791  // and cache them.
792  this->cache_elem_data();
793 
794  // Search the mesh for elements that have a neighboring element
795  // of dim+1 and set that element as the interior parent
796  this->detect_interior_parents();
797 
798  // Fix up node unique ids in case mesh generation code didn't take
799  // exceptional care to do so.
800  // MeshCommunication().make_node_unique_ids_parallel_consistent(*this);
801 
802  // We're going to still require that mesh generation code gets
803  // element unique ids consistent.
804 #if defined(DEBUG) && defined(LIBMESH_ENABLE_UNIQUE_ID)
805  MeshTools::libmesh_assert_valid_unique_ids(*this);
806 #endif
807 
808  // Reset our PointLocator. Any old locator is invalidated any time
809  // the elements in the underlying elements in the mesh have changed,
810  // so we clear it here.
811  this->clear_point_locator();
812 
813  // Allow our GhostingFunctor objects to reinit if necessary.
814  // Do this before partitioning and redistributing, and before
815  // deleting remote elements.
816  this->reinit_ghosting_functors();
817 
818  // Partition the mesh unless *all* partitioning is to be skipped.
819  // If only noncritical partitioning is to be skipped, the
820  // partition() call will still check for orphaned nodes.
821  if (!skip_partitioning())
822  this->partition();
823 
824  // If we're using DistributedMesh, we'll probably want it
825  // parallelized.
826  if (this->_allow_remote_element_removal)
827  this->delete_remote_elements();
828 
829  // Much of our boundary info may have been for now-remote parts of the mesh,
830  // in which case we don't want to keep local copies of data meant to be
831  // local. On the other hand we may have deleted, or the user may have added in
832  // a distributed fashion, boundary data that is meant to be global. So we
833  // handle both of those scenarios here
834  this->get_boundary_info().regenerate_id_sets();
835 
836  if (!_skip_renumber_nodes_and_elements)
837  this->renumber_nodes_and_elements();
838 
839  // The mesh is now prepared for use.
840  _is_prepared = true;
841 
842 #ifdef DEBUG
843  MeshTools::libmesh_assert_valid_boundary_ids(*this);
844 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_UNIQUE_ID
845  MeshTools::libmesh_assert_valid_unique_ids(*this);
846 #endif
847 #endif
848 }
libMesh::MeshBase::get_boundary_info
const BoundaryInfo & get_boundary_info() const
The information about boundary ids on the mesh.

libMesh::libmesh_assert
libmesh_assert(ctx)
void libMesh::UnstructuredMesh::read ( const std::string &  name,
void *  mesh_data = nullptr,
bool  skip_renumber_nodes_and_elements = false,
bool  skip_find_neighbors = false 
)
overridevirtualinherited

Reads the file specified by name.

Attempts to figure out the proper method by the file extension. This is now the only way to read a mesh. The UnstructuredMesh then initializes its data structures and is ready for use.

The skip_renumber_nodes_and_elements argument is now deprecated - to disallow renumbering, set MeshBase::allow_renumbering(false).

Set skip_find_neighbors=true to skip the find-neighbors operation during prepare_for_use. This operation isn't always necessary and it can be time-consuming, which is why we provide an option to skip it.

实现了 libMesh::MeshBase.

在文件 unstructured_mesh.C 第 885 行定义.

参考 libMesh::MeshBase::allow_find_neighbors(), libMesh::MeshBase::allow_renumbering(), libMesh::MeshBase::prepare_for_use() , 以及 libMesh::NameBasedIO::read().

889 {
890  // Set the skip_renumber_nodes_and_elements flag on all processors
891  // if necessary.
892  // This ensures that renumber_nodes_and_elements is *not* called
893  // during prepare_for_use() for certain types of mesh files.
894  // This is required in cases where there is an associated solution
895  // file which expects a certain ordering of the nodes.
896  if (name.rfind(".gmv") == name.size() - 4)
897  this->allow_renumbering(false);
898 
899  NameBasedIO(*this).read(name);
900 
901  if (skip_renumber_nodes_and_elements)
902  {
903  // Use MeshBase::allow_renumbering() yourself instead.
904  libmesh_deprecated();
905  this->allow_renumbering(false);
906  }
907 
908  // Done reading the mesh. Now prepare it for use.
909  const bool old_allow_find_neighbors = this->allow_find_neighbors();
910  this->allow_find_neighbors(!skip_find_neighbors);
911  this->prepare_for_use();
912  this->allow_find_neighbors(old_allow_find_neighbors);
913 }

libMesh::MeshBase::allow_find_neighbors

Definition: mesh_base.h:1177
unsigned int libMesh::MeshBase::recalculate_n_partitions ( )
inherited

In a few (very rare) cases, the user may have manually tagged the elements with specific processor IDs by hand, without using a partitioner.

In this case, the Mesh will not know that the total number of partitions, _n_parts, has changed, unless you call this function. This is an O(N active elements) calculation. The return value is the number of partitions, and _n_parts is also set by this function.

在文件 mesh_base.C 第 1538 行定义.

参考 libMesh::MeshBase::_n_parts , 以及 libMesh::ParallelObject::comm().

参考自 libMesh::MeshBase::partition().

1539 {
1540  // This requires an inspection on every processor
1541  parallel_object_only();
1542 
1543  unsigned int max_proc_id=0;
1544 
1545  for (const auto & elem : this->active_local_element_ptr_range())
1546  max_proc_id = std::max(max_proc_id, static_cast<unsigned int>(elem->processor_id()));
1547 
1548  // The number of partitions is one more than the max processor ID.
1549  _n_parts = max_proc_id+1;
1550 
1551  this->comm().max(_n_parts);
1552 
1553  return _n_parts;
1554 }
libMesh::MeshBase::_n_parts
unsigned int _n_parts
The number of partitions the mesh has.
Definition: mesh_base.h:1767

Definition: parallel_object.h:97
void libMesh::MeshBase::redistribute ( )
virtualinherited

Redistribute elements between processors.

This gets called automatically by the Partitioner, and merely notifies any GhostingFunctors of redistribution in the case of a ReplicatedMesh or serialized DistributedMesh

被 libMesh::DistributedMesh 重载.

924 {
925  // We now have all elements and nodes redistributed; our ghosting
926  // functors should be ready to redistribute and/or recompute any
927  // cached data they use too.
928  for (auto & gf : as_range(this->ghosting_functors_begin(),
929  this->ghosting_functors_end()))
930  gf->redistribute();
931 }

void libMesh::MeshBase::remove_orphaned_nodes ( )
inherited

Removes any orphaned nodes, nodes not connected to any elements.

Typically done automatically in prepare_for_use

在文件 mesh_base.C 第 688 行定义.

参考 libMesh::MeshBase::delete_node().

参考自 libMesh::MeshBase::prepare_for_use().

689 {
690  LOG_SCOPE("remove_orphaned_nodes()", "MeshBase");
691 
692  // Will hold the set of nodes that are currently connected to elements
693  std::unordered_set<Node *> connected_nodes;
694 
695  // Loop over the elements. Find which nodes are connected to at
696  // least one of them.
697  for (const auto & element : this->element_ptr_range())
698  for (auto & n : element->node_ref_range())
699  connected_nodes.insert(&n);
700 
701  for (const auto & node : this->node_ptr_range())
702  if (!connected_nodes.count(node))
703  this->delete_node(node);
704 }
libMesh::MeshBase::delete_node
virtual void delete_node(Node *n)=0
Removes the Node n from the mesh.
void libMesh::ReplicatedMesh::renumber_elem ( dof_id_type  old_id,
dof_id_type  new_id 
)
finaloverridevirtualinherited

Changes the id of element old_id, both by changing elem(old_id)->id() and by moving elem(old_id) in the mesh's internal container.

No element with the id new_id should already exist.

实现了 libMesh::MeshBase.

在文件 replicated_mesh.C 第 418 行定义.

参考 libMesh::ReplicatedMesh::_elements, libMesh::libmesh_assert() , 以及 libMesh::DofObject::set_id().

420 {
421  // This doesn't get used in serial yet
422  Elem * el = _elements[old_id];
423  libmesh_assert (el);
424 
425  el->set_id(new_id);
426  libmesh_assert (!_elements[new_id]);
427  _elements[new_id] = el;
428  _elements[old_id] = nullptr;
429 }

libMesh::libmesh_assert
libmesh_assert(ctx)
void libMesh::ReplicatedMesh::renumber_nodes_and_elements ( )
overridevirtualinherited

Remove nullptr elements from arrays.

实现了 libMesh::MeshBase.

在文件 replicated_mesh.C 第 708 行定义.

参考 libMesh::MeshBase::_constraint_rows, libMesh::ReplicatedMesh::_elements, libMesh::ReplicatedMesh::_n_nodes, libMesh::MeshBase::_skip_renumber_nodes_and_elements, libMesh::as_range(), libMesh::MeshBase::get_boundary_info(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::Elem::node_ref_range(), libMesh::BoundaryInfo::remove(), libMesh::DofObject::set_id() , 以及 libMesh::ReplicatedMesh::update_parallel_id_counts().

709 {
710  LOG_SCOPE("renumber_nodes_and_elem()", "Mesh");
711 
712  // node and element id counters
713  dof_id_type next_free_elem = 0;
714  dof_id_type next_free_node = 0;
715 
716  // Will hold the set of nodes that are currently connected to elements
717  std::unordered_set<Node *> connected_nodes;
718 
719  // Loop over the elements. Note that there may
720  // be nullptrs in the _elements vector from the coarsening
721  // process. Pack the elements in to a contiguous array
722  // and then trim any excess.
723  {
724  std::vector<Elem *>::iterator in = _elements.begin();
725  std::vector<Elem *>::iterator out_iter = _elements.begin();
726  const std::vector<Elem *>::iterator end = _elements.end();
727 
728  for (; in != end; ++in)
729  if (*in != nullptr)
730  {
731  Elem * el = *in;
732 
733  *out_iter = *in;
734  ++out_iter;
735 
736  // Increment the element counter
737  el->set_id (next_free_elem++);
738 
739  if (_skip_renumber_nodes_and_elements)
740  {
741  // Add this elements nodes to the connected list
742  for (auto & n : el->node_ref_range())
743  connected_nodes.insert(&n);
744  }
745  else // We DO want node renumbering
746  {
747  // Loop over this element's nodes. Number them,
748  // if they have not been numbered already. Also,
749  // position them in the _nodes vector so that they
750  // are packed contiguously from the beginning.
751  for (auto & n : el->node_ref_range())
752  if (n.id() == next_free_node) // don't need to process
753  next_free_node++; // [(src == dst) below]
754 
755  else if (n.id() > next_free_node) // need to process
756  {
757  // The source and destination indices
758  // for this node
759  const dof_id_type src_idx = n.id();
760  const dof_id_type dst_idx = next_free_node++;
761 
762  // ensure we want to swap a valid nodes
763  libmesh_assert(_nodes[src_idx]);
764 
765  // Swap the source and destination nodes
766  std::swap(_nodes[src_idx],
767  _nodes[dst_idx] );
768 
769  // Set proper indices where that makes sense
770  if (_nodes[src_idx] != nullptr)
771  _nodes[src_idx]->set_id (src_idx);
772  _nodes[dst_idx]->set_id (dst_idx);
773  }
774  }
775  }
776 
777  // Erase any additional storage. These elements have been
778  // copied into nullptr voids by the procedure above, and are
779  // thus repeated and unnecessary.
780  _elements.erase (out_iter, end);
781  }
782 
783 
784  if (_skip_renumber_nodes_and_elements)
785  {
786  // Loop over the nodes. Note that there may
787  // be nullptrs in the _nodes vector from the coarsening
788  // process. Pack the nodes in to a contiguous array
789  // and then trim any excess.
790 
791  std::vector<Node *>::iterator in = _nodes.begin();
792  std::vector<Node *>::iterator out_iter = _nodes.begin();
793  const std::vector<Node *>::iterator end = _nodes.end();
794 
795  for (; in != end; ++in)
796  if (*in != nullptr)
797  {
798  // This is a reference so that if we change the pointer it will change in the vector
799  Node * & nd = *in;
800 
801  // If this node is still connected to an elem, put it in the list
802  if (connected_nodes.find(nd) != connected_nodes.end())
803  {
804  *out_iter = nd;
805  ++out_iter;
806 
807  // Increment the node counter
808  nd->set_id (next_free_node++);
809  }
810  else // This node is orphaned, delete it!
811  {
812  this->get_boundary_info().remove (nd);
813  _constraint_rows.erase(nd);
814 
815  // delete the node
816  --_n_nodes;
817  delete nd;
818  nd = nullptr;
819  }
820  }
821 
822  // Erase any additional storage. Whatever was
823  _nodes.erase (out_iter, end);
824  }
825  else // We really DO want node renumbering
826  {
827  // Any nodes in the vector >= _nodes[next_free_node]
828  // are not connected to any elements and may be deleted
829  // if desired.
830 
831  // Now, delete the unused nodes
832  {
833  std::vector<Node *>::iterator nd = _nodes.begin();
834  const std::vector<Node *>::iterator end = _nodes.end();
835 
836  std::advance (nd, next_free_node);
837 
838  for (auto & node : as_range(nd, end))
839  {
840  // Mesh modification code might have already deleted some
841  // nodes
842  if (node == nullptr)
843  continue;
844 
845  // remove any boundary information associated with
846  // this node
847  this->get_boundary_info().remove (node);
848  _constraint_rows.erase(node);
849 
850  // delete the node
851  --_n_nodes;
852  delete node;
853  node = nullptr;
854  }
855 
856  _nodes.erase (nd, end);
857  }
858  }
859 
860  libmesh_assert_equal_to (next_free_elem, _elements.size());
861  libmesh_assert_equal_to (next_free_node, _nodes.size());
862 
863  this->update_parallel_id_counts();
864 }
libMesh::MeshBase::get_boundary_info
const BoundaryInfo & get_boundary_info() const
The information about boundary ids on the mesh.
Definition: mesh_base.h:155
libMesh::MeshBase::_skip_renumber_nodes_and_elements
bool _skip_renumber_nodes_and_elements
If this is true then renumbering will be kept to a minimum.
Definition: mesh_base.h:1833
libMesh::ReplicatedMesh::_elements
std::vector< Elem * > _elements
The elements in the mesh.
Definition: replicated_mesh.h:325
libMesh::BoundaryInfo::remove
void remove(const Node *node)
Removes the boundary conditions associated with node node, if any exist.
Definition: boundary_info.C:1620
libMesh::MeshBase::_constraint_rows
constraint_rows_type _constraint_rows
Definition: mesh_base.h:1974
libMesh::ReplicatedMesh::_n_nodes
const DofMap &dof_map LIBMESH_COMMA unsigned int dof_map LIBMESH_COMMA var_num unsigned char rflag processor_id_type pid const DofMap &dof_map LIBMESH_COMMA unsigned int dof_map LIBMESH_COMMA var_num DECLARE_NODE_ITERATORS(multi_evaluable_, std::vector< const DofMap * > dof_maps, dof_maps) protected dof_id_typ _n_nodes)
The vertices (spatial coordinates) of the mesh.
Definition: replicated_mesh.h:310
libMesh::as_range

Helper function that allows us to treat a homogenous pair as a range.
Definition: simple_range.h:57
libMesh::libmesh_assert
libmesh_assert(ctx)
libMesh::ReplicatedMesh::update_parallel_id_counts
virtual void update_parallel_id_counts() override
Updates parallel caches so that methods like n_elem() accurately reflect changes on other processors...
Definition: replicated_mesh.C:678
libMesh::dof_id_type
uint8_t dof_id_type
Definition: id_types.h:67
virtual void libMesh::ReplicatedMesh::reserve_elem ( const dof_id_type  ne)
inlinefinaloverridevirtualinherited

Reserves space for a known number of elements.

注解
This method may or may not do anything, depending on the actual Mesh implementation. If you know the number of elements you will add and call this method before repeatedly calling add_point() the implementation will be more efficient.

实现了 libMesh::MeshBase.

138  { _nodes.reserve (nn); }
void libMesh::MeshBase::set_count_lower_dim_elems_in_point_locator ( bool  count_lower_dim_elems)

void libMesh::MeshBase::set_default_mapping_data ( const unsigned char  data)
inlineinherited

virtual void libMesh::MeshBase::set_distributed ( )
inlinevirtualinherited

Asserts that not all elements and nodes of the mesh necessarily exist on the current processor.

Only valid to call on classes which can be created in a distributed form.

被 libMesh::DistributedMesh 重载.

在文件 mesh_base.h 第 216 行定义.

参考自 libMesh::CheckpointIO::read().

217  { libmesh_error(); }
void libMesh::MeshBase::set_elem_dimensions ( std::set< unsigned char >  elem_dims)
inherited

Most of the time you should not need to call this, as the element dimensions will be set automatically by a call to cache_elem_data(), therefore only call this if you know what you're doing.

In some specialized situations, for example when adding a single Elem on all procs, it can be faster to skip calling cache_elem_data() and simply specify the element dimensions manually, which is why this setter exists.

在文件 mesh_base.C 第 331 行定义.

参考 libMesh::MeshBase::_elem_dims , 以及 libMesh::MeshBase::cache_elem_data().

332 {
333 #ifdef DEBUG
334  // In debug mode, we call cache_elem_data() and then make sure
335  // the result actually agrees with what the user specified.
336  parallel_object_only();
337 
338  this->cache_elem_data();
339  libmesh_assert_msg(_elem_dims == elem_dims, \
340  "Specified element dimensions does not match true element dimensions!");
341 #endif
342 
343  _elem_dims = std::move(elem_dims);
344 }

void libMesh::MeshBase::set_mesh_dimension ( unsigned char  d)
inlineinherited

Resets the logical dimension of the mesh.

If the mesh has elements of multiple dimensions, this should be set to the largest dimension. E.g. if the mesh has 1D and 2D elements, this should be set to 2. If the mesh has 2D and 3D elements, this should be set to 3.

void libMesh::ReplicatedMesh::set_next_unique_id ( unique_id_type  id)
finaloverridevirtualinherited

Sets the next available unique id to be used.

On a ReplicatedMesh, or when adding unpartitioned objects to a DistributedMesh, this must be kept in sync on all processors.

On a DistributedMesh, other unique_id values (larger than this one) may be chosen next, to allow unique_id assignment without communication.

实现了 libMesh::MeshBase.

void libMesh::MeshBase::set_point_locator_close_to_point_tol ( Real  val)
inherited

Set value used by PointLocatorBase::close_to_point_tol().

Defaults to 0.0. If nonzero, calls close_to_point_tol() whenever a new PointLocator is built for use by this Mesh. Since the Mesh controls the creation and destruction of the PointLocator, if there are any parameters we need to customize on it, the Mesh will need to know about them.

Definition: mesh_base.h:1921
void libMesh::MeshBase::skip_noncritical_partitioning ( bool  skip)
inlineinherited

If true is passed in then the elements on this mesh will no longer be (re)partitioned, and the nodes on this mesh will only be repartitioned if they are found "orphaned" via coarsening or other removal of the last element responsible for their node/element processor id consistency.

注解
It would probably be a bad idea to call this on a DistributedMesh before the first partitioning has happened... because no elements would get assigned to your processor pool.
Skipping partitioning can have adverse effects on your performance when using AMR... i.e. you could get large load imbalances. However you might still want to use this if the communication and computation of the rebalance and repartition is too high for your application.

It is also possible, for backwards-compatibility purposes, to skip noncritical partitioning by resetting the partitioner() pointer for this mesh.

在文件 mesh_base.h 第 1209 行定义.

参考 libMesh::MeshBase::_skip_noncritical_partitioning.

参考自 libMesh::MeshTools::correct_node_proc_ids().

1210  { _skip_noncritical_partitioning = skip; }
libMesh::MeshBase::_skip_noncritical_partitioning
bool _skip_noncritical_partitioning
If this is true then no partitioning should be done with the possible exception of orphaned nodes...
Definition: mesh_base.h:1821

void libMesh::MeshBase::skip_partitioning ( bool  skip)
inlineinherited

If true is passed in then nothing on this mesh will be (re)partitioned.

注解
The caveats for skip_noncritical_partitioning() still apply, and removing elements from a mesh with this setting enabled can leave node processor ids in an inconsistent state (not matching any attached element), causing failures in other library code. Do not use this setting along with element deletion or coarsening.

Definition: mesh_base.h:1826
unsigned int libMesh::MeshBase::spatial_dimension ( ) const
inherited
返回
The "spatial dimension" of the mesh.

The spatial dimension is defined as:

1 - for an exactly x-aligned mesh of 1D elements 2 - for an exactly x-y planar mesh of 2D elements 3 - otherwise

No tolerance checks are performed to determine whether the Mesh is x-aligned or x-y planar, only strict equality with zero in the higher dimensions is checked. Also, x-z and y-z planar meshes are considered to have spatial dimension == 3.

The spatial dimension is updated during prepare_for_use() based on the dimensions of the various elements present in the Mesh, but is never automatically decreased by this function.

For example, if the user calls set_spatial_dimension(2) and then later inserts 3D elements into the mesh, Mesh::spatial_dimension() will return 3 after the next call to prepare_for_use(). On the other hand, if the user calls set_spatial_dimension(3) and then inserts only x-aligned 1D elements into the Mesh, mesh.spatial_dimension() will remain 3.

在文件 mesh_base.C 第 493 行定义.

参考 libMesh::MeshBase::_spatial_dimension.

参考自 libMesh::MeshBase::get_info(), libMesh::Nemesis_IO_Helper::initialize() , 以及 libMesh::ExodusII_IO_Helper::initialize().

494 {
495  return cast_int<unsigned int>(_spatial_dimension);
496 }
libMesh::MeshBase::_spatial_dimension
unsigned char _spatial_dimension
The &quot;spatial dimension&quot; of the Mesh.
Definition: mesh_base.h:1897
std::size_t libMesh::UnstructuredMesh::stitch_meshes ( const MeshBase &  other_mesh,
boundary_id_type  this_mesh_boundary,
boundary_id_type  other_mesh_boundary,
Real  tol = TOLERANCE,
bool  clear_stitched_boundary_ids = false,
bool  verbose = true,
bool  use_binary_search = true,
bool  enforce_all_nodes_match_on_boundaries = false,
bool  merge_boundary_nodes_all_or_nothing = false,
bool  remap_subdomain_ids = false 
)
inherited

Stitch other_mesh to this mesh so that this mesh is the union of the two meshes.

this_mesh_boundary and other_mesh_boundary are used to specify a dim-1 dimensional surface on which we seek to merge any "overlapping" nodes, where we use the parameter tol as a relative tolerance (relative to the smallest edge length on the surfaces being stitched) to determine whether or not nodes are overlapping. If clear_stitched_boundary_ids==true, this function clears boundary_info IDs in this mesh associated this_mesh_boundary and other_mesh_boundary. If use_binary_search is true, we use an optimized "sort then binary search" algorithm for finding matching nodes. Otherwise we use a N^2 algorithm (which can be more reliable at dealing with slightly misaligned meshes). If enforce_all_nodes_match_on_boundaries is true, we throw an error if the number of nodes on the specified boundaries don't match the number of nodes that were merged. This is a helpful error check in some cases. If this is true, it overrides the value of merge_boundary_nodes_all_or_nothing. If skip_find_neighbors is true, a faster stitching method is used, where the lists of neighbors for each elements are copied as well and patched, without calling the time-consuming find_neighbors() function. This option is now hard-coded to true. If merge_boundary_nodes_all_or_nothing is true, instead of throwing an error like enforce_all_nodes_match_on_boundaries, the meshes are combined anyway but coincident nodes are not merged into single nodes. This is useful in cases where you are not sure if the boundaries are fully conforming beforehand and you want to handle the non-conforming cases differently.

Note that the element IDs for elements in the stitched mesh corresponding to "this" mesh will be unchanged. The IDs for elements corresponding to other_mesh will be incremented by this->max_elem_id().

There is no simple a priori relationship between node IDs in "this" mesh and other_mesh and node IDs in the stitched mesh because the number of nodes (and hence the node IDs) in the stitched mesh depend on how many nodes are stitched.

If remap_subdomain_ids is true then we assume that some subdomain ids might have been autogenerated, so we remap them as necessary, treating subdomain names as the important thing for consistency; if we have missing names and cannot infer a consistent resolution to an id conflict then we exit with an error. If remap_subdomain_ids is false then we revert to the older libMesh behavior: leave all subdomain ids alone and woe unto you if you weren't keeping track of them.

返回
the count of how many nodes were merged between the two meshes. This can be zero in the case of no matching nodes or if merge_boundary_nodes_all_or_nothing was active and relevant.

在文件 unstructured_mesh.C 第 1734 行定义.

参考 libMesh::UnstructuredMesh::stitching_helper().

1744 {
1745  LOG_SCOPE("stitch_meshes()", "UnstructuredMesh");

1747  this_mesh_boundary_id,
1748  other_mesh_boundary_id,
1749  tol,
1750  clear_stitched_boundary_ids,
1751  verbose,
1752  use_binary_search,
1753  enforce_all_nodes_match_on_boundaries,
1754  true,
1755  merge_boundary_nodes_all_or_nothing,
1756  remap_subdomain_ids);
1757 }

inherited
返回
A pointer to a subordinate PointLocatorBase object for this mesh, constructing a master PointLocator first if necessary. This should not be used in threaded or non-parallel_only code unless the master has already been constructed.

1559 {
1560  // If there's no master point locator, then we need one.
1561  if (_point_locator.get() == nullptr)
1562  {
1563  // PointLocator construction may not be safe within threads
1564  libmesh_assert(!Threads::in_threads);
1565 
1566  // And it may require parallel communication
1567  parallel_object_only();
1568

1573 #endif

1577  }

1580  // sub-locator easily.

1584 #else

bool libMesh::ReplicatedMesh::subclass_locally_equals ( const MeshBase &  other_mesh) const
overridevirtualinherited

Shim to allow operator == (&) to behave like a virtual function without having to be one.

实现了 libMesh::MeshBase.

在文件 replicated_mesh.C 第 60 行定义.

参考 libMesh::ReplicatedMesh::_n_elem, libMesh::ReplicatedMesh::_n_nodes , 以及 libMesh::MeshBase::_next_unique_id.

61 {
62  const ReplicatedMesh * rep_mesh_ptr =
63  dynamic_cast<const ReplicatedMesh *>(&other_mesh_base);
64  if (!rep_mesh_ptr)
65  return false;
66  const ReplicatedMesh & other_mesh = *rep_mesh_ptr;
67 
68  if (_n_nodes != other_mesh._n_nodes ||
69  _n_elem != other_mesh._n_elem ||
70 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_UNIQUE_ID
71  _next_unique_id != other_mesh._next_unique_id ||
72 #endif
73  !this->nodes_and_elements_equal(other_mesh))
74  return false;
75 
76  return true;
77 }

libMesh::MeshBase::_next_unique_id
unique_id_type _next_unique_id
The next available unique id for assigning ids to DOF objects.
Definition: mesh_base.h:1814
libMesh::ReplicatedMesh::_n_elem
dof_id_type _n_elem
Definition: replicated_mesh.h:327
libMesh::ReplicatedMesh::ReplicatedMesh
ReplicatedMesh(const Parallel::Communicator &comm_in, unsigned char dim=1)
Constructor.
Definition: replicated_mesh.C:40
void libMesh::MeshBase::subdomain_ids ( std::set< subdomain_id_type > &  ids,
const bool  global = true 
) const
inherited

Constructs a list of all subdomain identifiers in the local mesh if global == false, and in the global mesh if global == true (default).

Subdomains correspond to separate subsets of the mesh which could correspond e.g. to different materials in a solid mechanics application, or regions where different physical processes are important. The subdomain mapping is independent from the parallel decomposition.

Unpartitioned elements are included in the set in the case that global == true. If global == false, the unpartitioned elements are not included because unpartitioned elements do not have a sense of locality.

在文件 mesh_base.C 第 897 行定义.

参考 libMesh::ParallelObject::comm().

参考自 libMesh::MeshBase::n_local_subdomains(), libMesh::MeshBase::n_subdomains() , 以及 libMesh::TecplotIO::TecplotIO().

898 {
899  // This requires an inspection on every processor
900  if (global)
901  parallel_object_only();
902 
903  ids.clear();
904 
905  for (const auto & elem : this->active_local_element_ptr_range())
906  ids.insert(elem->subdomain_id());
907 
908  if (global)
909  {
910  // Only include the unpartitioned elements if the user requests the global IDs.
911  // In the case of the local subdomain IDs, it doesn't make sense to include the
912  // unpartitioned elements because said elements do not have a sense of locality.
913  for (const auto & elem : this->active_unpartitioned_element_ptr_range())
914  ids.insert(elem->subdomain_id());
915 
916  // Some subdomains may only live on other processors
917  this->comm().set_union(ids);
918  }
919 }
libMesh::ParallelObject::comm
const Parallel::Communicator & comm() const
Definition: parallel_object.h:97

1618 {

1620  static const std::string empty;
1621

1623  if (iter == _block_id_to_name.end())
1624  return empty;
1625  else
1626  return iter->second;

std::map<dof_id_type, const MeshBase::elemset_type *> libMesh::MeshBase::_elemset_codes
protectedinherited

Map from "element set code" to list of set ids to which that element belongs (and vice-versa).

Remarks: 1.) The elemset code is a dof_id_type because (if used) it is stored as an extra_integer (named "elemset_code") on all elements, and extra_integers are of type dof_id_type. Elements which do not belong to any set should be assigned an elemset code of DofObject::invalid_id. 2.) Element sets can be thought of as a generalization of the concept of a subdomain. Subdomains have the following restrictions: a.) A given element can only belong to a single subdomain b.) When using Exodus file input/output, subdomains are (unfortunately) tied to the concept of exodus element blocks, which consist of a single geometric element type, somewhat limiting their generality. 3.) The user is responsible for filling in the values of this map in a consistent manner, unless the elemsets are read in from an Exodus file, in which case the elemset codes will be set up automatically. The codes can basically be chosen arbitrarily, with the one requirement that elements which belong to no sets should have a set code of DofObject::invalid_id. 4.) We also keep a list of all the elemset ids which have been added in order to support O(1) performance behavior in n_elemsets() calls.

在文件 mesh_base.h 第 1889 行定义.

参考自 libMesh::MeshBase::add_elemset_code(), libMesh::MeshBase::change_elemset_code(), libMesh::MeshBase::change_elemset_id(), libMesh::MeshBase::clear(), libMesh::MeshBase::get_elemset_codes(), libMesh::MeshBase::get_elemsets(), libMesh::MeshBase::get_info(), libMesh::MeshBase::locally_equals(), libMesh::MeshBase::MeshBase() , 以及 libMesh::MeshBase::operator=().

std::map<MeshBase::elemset_type, dof_id_type> libMesh::MeshBase::_elemset_codes_inverse_map
protectedinherited

在文件 mesh_base.h 第 1890 行定义.

参考自 libMesh::MeshBase::add_elemset_code(), libMesh::MeshBase::change_elemset_code(), libMesh::MeshBase::change_elemset_id(), libMesh::MeshBase::clear(), libMesh::MeshBase::get_elemset_code(), libMesh::MeshBase::MeshBase() , 以及 libMesh::MeshBase::operator=().

unsigned int libMesh::MeshBase::_n_parts
protectedinherited

The number of partitions the mesh has.

This is set by the partitioners, and may not be changed directly by the user.

注解
The number of partitions need not equal this->n_processors(), consider for example the case where you simply want to partition a mesh on one processor and view the result in GMV.

在文件 mesh_base.h 第 1767 行定义.

std::unique_ptr<PointLocatorBase> libMesh::MeshBase::_point_locator
mutableprotectedinherited

A PointLocator class for this mesh.

This will not actually be built unless needed. Further, since we want our point_locator() method to be const (yet do the dynamic allocating) this needs to be mutable. Since the PointLocatorBase::build() member is used, and it operates on a constant reference to the mesh, this is OK.

unsigned char libMesh::MeshBase::_spatial_dimension
protectedinherited

The "spatial dimension" of the Mesh.

See the documentation for Mesh::spatial_dimension() for more information.

在文件 mesh_base.h 第 1897 行定义.

参考自 libMesh::MeshBase::cache_elem_data(), libMesh::MeshBase::locally_equals(), libMesh::MeshBase::operator=(), libMesh::MeshBase::set_spatial_dimension() , 以及 libMesh::MeshBase::spatial_dimension().

std::unique_ptr<BoundaryInfo> libMesh::MeshBase::boundary_info
protectedinherited

This class holds the boundary information.

It can store nodes, edges, and faces with a corresponding id that facilitates setting boundary conditions.

Direct access to this class is now officially deprecated and will be removed in future libMesh versions. Use the get_boundary_info() accessor instead.

在文件 mesh_base.h 第 1725 行定义.

参考自 libMesh::MeshBase::clear(), libMesh::MeshBase::get_boundary_info(), libMesh::MeshBase::locally_equals() , 以及 libMesh::MeshBase::operator=().
